description: From translingual Psyllidae, from Ancient Greek ψύλλα (psúlla).

entries.meaning: Any of the host-specific plant-feeding insects of the family Psyllidae, which feed on plant juices.
examples: Psyllids, sometimes called 'suckers', may either be regarded as constituting a single large family (sensu stricto) of about 2000 species, or else about eight closely related families (sensu lato).
